1.text: Hear, ye children, the instruction of a father, and attend to know intelligence;

2.text: for I give you good doctrine: forsake ye not my law.

3.text: For I was a son unto my father, tender and an only one in the sight of my mother.

4.text: And he taught me, and said unto me, Let thy heart retain my words; keep my commandments and live.

5.text: Get wisdom, get intelligence: forget [it] not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.

6.text: Forsake her not, and she shall keep thee; love her, and she shall preserve thee.

7.text: The beginning of wisdom [is], Get wisdom; and with all thy getting get intelligence.

8.text: Exalt her, and she shall promote thee; she shall bring thee to honour when thou dost embrace her.

9.text: She shall give to thy head a garland of grace; a crown of glory will she bestow upon thee.

10.text: Hear, my son, and receive my sayings, and the years of thy life shall be multiplied.

11.text: I will teach thee in the way of wisdom, I will lead thee in paths of uprightness.

12.text: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened; and when thou runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

13.text: Take fast hold of instruction, let [her] not go: keep her, for she is thy life.

14.text: Enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of evil [men]:

15.text: avoid it, pass not by it; turn from it, and pass away.

16.text: For they sleep not except they have done mischief, and their sleep is taken away unless they have caused [some] to fall.

17.text: For they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of violence.

18.text: But the path of the righteous is as the shining light, going on and brightening until the day be fully come.

19.text: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they know not at what they stumble.

20.text: My son, attend to my words; incline thine ear unto my sayings.

21.text: Let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of thy heart.

22.text: For they are life unto those that find them, and health to all their flesh.

23.text: Keep thy heart more than anything that is guarded; for out of it are the issues of life.

24.text: Put away from thee perverseness of mouth, and corrupt lips put far from thee.

25.text: Let thine eyes look right on, and let thine eyelids look straight before thee.

26.text: Ponder the path of thy feet, and let all thy ways be well-ordered.

27.text: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left; remove thy foot from evil.
